# p-flex-item



<!-- Auto Generated Below -->


## Properties

| Property    | Attribute    | Description                                                                                                                                                                      | Type                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | Default     |
| ----------- | ------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- |
| `alignSelf` | `align-self` | Defines how this flex item is aligned along the cross axis. This overwrites the cross axis alignment set by the container. Corresponds to the "alignSelf" css property.          | `string \| { base?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; xs?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; s?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; m?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; l?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; xl?: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; } & { base: "center" \| "auto" \| "flex-start" \| "flex-end" \| "stretch" \| "baseline"; }`                                                                                                                                      | `'auto'`    |
| `flex`      | `flex`       | The shorthand property for the combined definition of "shrink", "grow" and "basis"                                                                                               | `string \| { base?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; xs?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; s?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; m?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; l?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; xl?: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; } & { base: "none" \| "auto" \| "initial" \| "equal"; }`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | `'initial'` |
| `grow`      | `grow`       | The ability to allow/disallow the flex child to grow.                                                                                                                            | `0 \| 1 \| string \| { base?: 0 \| 1; xs?: 0 \| 1; s?: 0 \| 1; m?: 0 \| 1; l?: 0 \| 1; xl?: 0 \| 1; } & { base: 0 \| 1; }`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | `0`         |
| `offset`    | `offset`     | The offset of the column. You can also supply values for specific breakpoints, like {base: "none", l: "one-quarter"}. You always need to provide a base value when doing this.   | `string \| { base?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; xs?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; s?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; m?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; l?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; xl?: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; } & { base: "none" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters"; }`                                                                       | `'none'`    |
| `shrink`    | `shrink`     | The ability to allow/disallow the flex child to shrink.                                                                                                                          | `0 \| 1 \| string \| { base?: 0 \| 1; xs?: 0 \| 1; s?: 0 \| 1; m?: 0 \| 1; l?: 0 \| 1; xl?: 0 \| 1; } & { base: 0 \| 1; }`                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | `1`         |
| `width`     | `width`      | The width of the flex item. You can also supply values for specific breakpoints, like {base: "full", l: "one-quarter"}. You always need to provide a base value when doing this. | `string \| { base?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; xs?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; s?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; m?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; l?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; xl?: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; } & { base: "auto" \| "one-quarter" \| "one-third" \| "half" \| "two-thirds" \| "three-quarters" \| "full"; }` | `'auto'`    |
